duties_responsibilities.duty: Manage one or more handscoring contracts, including scheduling, resource planning, training, coordinating with program and project managers, and post-project work.
Utilize thorough knowledge of science topics for Elementary, Middle, and High School Science, apply state and national science standards, and provide expertise and management in Math assessments.
Communicate with various roles via chat, email, phone, posted reports, video conference meetings, and in-person or virtual interactions.
Mentor and train Scoring Directors, Supervisors, and Scorers, and provide live or pre-recorded training on Science and potentially Math items.
Make sound business decisions under tight deadlines, maintain a confidential work environment, and use common Microsoft Office applications and video conferencing tools.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor’s degree required, preferably in Life Science or Physical Sciences, with additional Math college courses preferred (Master's preferred). Two (2) years assessment industry experience as a Scoring Director or equivalent
